grayhaven.gmOnlyJournal: NPC DOSSIER (GM): Lord Mayor Alden Rutherford

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about town law
rumorTriggers.note: He emphasizes spellcasting ban + ‘order’.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs mention Zhentarim
rumorTriggers.note: He deflects; a slip reveals fear of losing control.

questHooks.title: The Safety Net
questHooks.start: Mayor requests discreet help reducing north-road robberies without public scandal.
complications: Zhentarim try to redirect PCs toward a rival bandit crew.
Magistrate demands a public punishment regardless of evidence.

questHooks.title: Receipts in the Rain
questHooks.start: A ledger page goes missing from the Mayor’s office. He wants it recovered quietly.
complications: The page is already with Harpers.
Or with Varron Dusk, baiting PCs.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about roads
rumorTriggers.note: She has updated patrol intel.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs show proof of Zhent activity
rumorTriggers.note: She turns it into actionable leads.

questHooks.title: Intercept the Courier
questHooks.start: A Harper courier is overdue. Voss wants PCs to find them before Zhents do.
complications: Courier is alive but blight-sick.
Courier is captured at the inn under false names.

questHooks.title: The Patrol Gap
questHooks.start: Voss needs bodies for one night to cover a gap while she runs an ‘inspection’.
complications: Highwaymen test the gap.
A Zhent shipment moves during the same window.

grayhaven.gmOnlyJournal: NPC DOSSIER (GM): High Priestess Selene Dawnbreak

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about the Gloomwaste
rumorTriggers.note: She knows the oldest oral history fragments.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs mention undead
rumorTriggers.note: She provides wards and warnings.

questHooks.title: Dawnward Rite
questHooks.start: Selene asks PCs to retrieve clean springwater from a north-forest source for a warding rite.
complications: Source is tainted (quietly).
Owlbear signs near the spring.

questHooks.title: A False Miracle
questHooks.start: Someone in town claims a ‘miracle cure’ for blight-sickness. Selene suspects a trap.
complications: It’s a lich agent’s lure.
The seller is just desperate and wrong.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about town politics
rumorTriggers.note: She trades truth for favors.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs show ruin glyph rubbings
rumorTriggers.note: She recognizes a family-linked symbol.

questHooks.title: The Family Lockbox
questHooks.start: Dora wants a sealed heirloom box recovered from an abandoned east farm before someone else finds it.
complications: Box is watched by a lich-tainted scavenger.
Stouthearts think it’s stolen goods.

questHooks.title: Quiet Survey
questHooks.start: Dora hires PCs to mark where blight is creeping toward the nearest fields.
complications: Maps fail in the Gloomwaste fringe.
A ‘friendly’ Zhent offers to accompany them.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs buy him a drink
rumorTriggers.note: He mixes truth and lies; GM can seed real ruin details.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs sober him (care, magic, or kindness)
rumorTriggers.note: He can provide a mostly-accurate approach sketch.

questHooks.title: A Dead Friend’s Token
questHooks.start: Roderick begs PCs to retrieve a token he dropped fleeing the outer walls.
complications: Token is on a corpse that now walks.
Token is bait placed by a lich agent.

grayhaven.gmOnlyJournal: NPC DOSSIER (GM): Zhentarim Handler Varron Dusk

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask around about ‘merchant protection’
rumorTriggers.note: He hears quickly; a ‘friendly’ offer arrives.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs interfere with a shipment
rumorTriggers.note: Retaliation escalates.

questHooks.title: A Clean Job (Not Clean)
questHooks.start: Varron offers paid escort for ‘medicine’ crates to the north road.
complications: Crates are contraband or cursed.
Harpers tail the PCs.

questHooks.title: Burn a Rival Crew
questHooks.start: He asks PCs to expose a ‘bandit’ group (actually his rivals) to the militia.
complications: PCs become complicit.
Rivals are innocents framed as bandits.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about trade or shortages
rumorTriggers.note: He frames everything as ‘logistics’ and lets a real truth slip.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs mention the north road or highwaymen
rumorTriggers.note: He knows recent caravan losses and names.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs press about contraband
rumorTriggers.note: He deflects, but gives a ‘wrong’ warehouse location that is actually a test.

questHooks.title: The Missing Manifest
questHooks.start: A shipment manifest vanished after the market closed. Gildon hires the PCs to recover it before it reaches the wrong hands.
complications: The manifest proves a Zhentarim shipment (Gildon didn’t know, or pretends he didn’t).
A militia clerk already copied it.
The manifest is bait to identify nosy outsiders.

questHooks.title: A Quiet Price War
questHooks.start: Gildon asks PCs to convince a stubborn supplier (or intimidate a rival broker) so food prices don’t spike this week.
complications: Supplier is threatened by highwaymen.
Bramblefoots want the price spike to justify an ordinance.
Zhents offer ‘help’ that increases their grip.

grayhaven.gmOnlyNotes: Gildon launders Zhent payments through ‘freight fees’ and ‘loss insurance’. He is not loyal to Zhent ideology, only to solvency.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about wagons, repairs, or travel gear
rumorTriggers.note: She shares road gossip with practical details.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs mention the east road or Gloomwaste
rumorTriggers.note: She’s heard the ‘wood warps overnight’ stories (some true).

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs show unusual splinters, rot, or blight-taint on wood
rumorTriggers.note: She recognizes ‘sour sap’ as a bad sign.

questHooks.title: Axle in the Mud
questHooks.start: A south-road patrol wagon snapped an axle near the river bend. Bessa needs escort to deliver parts and bring the team home.
complications: Bandits shadow the repair team.
A ‘helpful’ stranger offers a shortcut (lich agent).
The broken axle shows signs of unnatural brittleness.

questHooks.title: The Ghost Cart
questHooks.start: A cart returned from the east road by itself, harness still warm, wood stained gray-green. Bessa asks PCs to investigate before the militia burns it.
complications: Cart carries a hidden compartment with a ruin fragment.
Touching it risks Blight exposure.
Zhents want the compartment.

grayhaven.gmOnlyNotes: Bessa is a soft counterweight to harsh law: she can vouch for PCs to militia if they help her crews.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs applaud, tip well, or buy him a meal
rumorTriggers.note: He ‘accidentally’ shares a true rumor wrapped in a joke.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs mention Voss or show militia papers
rumorTriggers.note: He tests them with a coded phrase.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about hidden roads or safehouses
rumorTriggers.note: He provides a meeting sign and a false trail.

questHooks.title: A Crow Verse for a Friend
questHooks.start: Cyril asks PCs to deliver a ‘song sheet’ to the innkeeper. It’s a coded Harper message.
complications: Zhentarim Cutter Vesk intercepts it.
Innkeeper is watched by militia.
The code references the cavern waystation by metaphor.

questHooks.title: The False Ballad
questHooks.start: Cyril needs a staged rumor to flush out a Zhent listener. PCs must spread it convincingly.
complications: The rumor enrages Stouthearts.
The mayor hears it and panics.
The lich’s agents exploit the chaos.

grayhaven.gmOnlyNotes: Cyril uses ‘crow verses’ to identify targets. If PCs earn trust, he can confirm which rumors are seeded by Harpers.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask for patrol work or guard jobs
rumorTriggers.note: She assigns practical work first, then tests reliability.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about spellcasting laws
rumorTriggers.note: She repeats policy and warns about public humiliation.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs mention orcs or raids
rumorTriggers.note: She gives a recent incident location.

questHooks.title: Checkpoint Night
questHooks.start: Brinna needs extra eyes at a temporary checkpoint after reports of contraband slipping in.
complications: Zhents attempt to bribe PCs.
A Harper courier is nearly caught.
A blight-tainted traveler collapses, causing panic.

questHooks.title: The Missing Patrol
questHooks.start: A two-person patrol hasn’t reported in from the south road. Brinna orders a discreet search before the mayor hears.
complications: The patrol found evidence of a lich agent.
Highwaymen set a trap using militia uniforms.
The patrol is alive but refuses to speak (fear, curse, or blackmail).

grayhaven.gmOnlyNotes: Brinna is not corrupt, but she can be pushed into escalating force if Stability clock worsens.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs walk the streets at night
rumorTriggers.note: Pell shows up with lantern and nervous questions.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about strange sounds or omens
rumorTriggers.note: He describes the ‘east singing’ (true, but misunderstood).

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs mention fog, runes, or humming stones
rumorTriggers.note: He’s a conduit for omen hooks.

questHooks.title: Lanterns That Won’t Stay Lit
questHooks.start: Lanterns near the east gate keep going out. Pell begs the PCs to help before people decide it’s ‘witchcraft’.
complications: It’s a minor lich agent’s warding charm.
A prank is masking a real phenomenon.
Militia suspects spellcasters and escalates.

questHooks.title: Tiny Footprints
questHooks.start: A child’s footprints lead toward the disused east road in the fog. Pell is too frightened to go alone.
complications: It’s an owlbear false trail set by a scavenger.
A Zhent runner is using the child as a decoy.
The child is lured by a humming shard (Gloomwaste influence).

grayhaven.gmOnlyNotes: His ‘singing’ is a planar harmonic. If PCs bring proof, Harper Intelligence advances +1.

grayhaven.gmOnlyJournal: NPC DOSSIER (GM): Brother Harun of the Dawn

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask at the shrine about blessings or cures
rumorTriggers.note: He shares old stories recorded in the shrine ledger.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs show a blight symptom or tainted object
rumorTriggers.note: He reacts strongly and requests Selene’s help.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about ‘ancient curses’
rumorTriggers.note: He quotes scripture, sometimes misapplied.

questHooks.title: The Ledger of Dawn
questHooks.start: Harun asks PCs to recover a missing page from the shrine’s old ledger describing the first blight sightings.
complications: The page implicates someone’s ancestor (Bramblefoot connection).
Zhents want it to blackmail Selene.
The page is encoded in a hymn stanza.

questHooks.title: Mercy for the Condemned
questHooks.start: A suspected ‘spellcaster’ is about to be publicly humiliated. Harun begs the PCs to find the truth fast.
complications: The accused is innocent but hiding a Harper tie.
The accused is guilty but controlled by a tainted charm.
The crowd is one spark from riot.

grayhaven.gmOnlyNotes: Harun is a truth engine: he can ‘surface’ lore via records and accidentally leak it to the wrong ears.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs buy spices, tea, or chat kindly
rumorTriggers.note: Hilda trades gossip for warmth, not coin.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs mention Bramblefoots
rumorTriggers.note: She shares Stoutheart grievances and Lowstone sentiment.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about missing animals or odd smells
rumorTriggers.note: She notices taint before others do.

questHooks.title: The Sour Sack
questHooks.start: A spice sack arrived smelling like damp graves. Hilda wants it traced before it’s used in food.
complications: It’s tainted from a Gloomwaste fringe route.
Zhents planted it to discredit Stouthearts.
A lich agent uses it as a subtle vector.

questHooks.title: Lowstone Meeting
questHooks.start: Hilda invites PCs to a Lowstone gathering where locals debate vigilantism. PCs can defuse or inflame tensions.
complications: A disguised Zhent agitator pushes violence.
Militia arrives and escalates.
A real crime interrupts, turning debate into action.

grayhaven.gmOnlyNotes: Hilda is a pressure valve for resentment. If PCs alienate her, Stoutheart Resentment advances +1.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs visit the outskirts farms
rumorTriggers.note: Odo points out tracks and warns about the treeline.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about missing livestock
rumorTriggers.note: He tells the owlbear story (true).

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs mention Bramblefoots’ influence
rumorTriggers.note: He offers harsh opinions, some accurate, some not.

questHooks.title: Owlbear at the Fold
questHooks.start: Odo’s goats were taken. He wants the owlbear driven off or slain, and a claw as proof.
complications: The owlbear is blight-tainted (harder, stranger behavior).
A second predator follows the first.
The ‘den’ hides a ruin shard.

questHooks.title: Black Grass Line
questHooks.start: Odo found a line of blackened grass advancing overnight. He wants PCs to mark and investigate before his fields go next.
complications: Maps become unreliable near the fringe.
Orc scouts test defenses.
Militia blames ‘witchcraft’ and threatens arrests.

grayhaven.gmOnlyNotes: Odo can become a community leader if PCs help. If ignored, he drifts into vigilantism when resentment rises.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs befriend Kellan or show kindness
rumorTriggers.note: He shares what adults say when they think kids aren’t listening.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about the riverbank or strange stones
rumorTriggers.note: He can lead them to a humming shard location.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs mention the east road at night
rumorTriggers.note: He’s seen fog ‘flow uphill’ (true omen).

questHooks.title: The Humming Stone
questHooks.start: Kellan begs the PCs to help retrieve a humming stone he dropped near the river bend after seeing ‘lights’ in the fog.
complications: The shard attracts undead wildlife.
A Zhent scout wants it.
Keeping it risks subtle blight exposure.

questHooks.title: A Fool’s Dare
questHooks.start: Kellan and friends dared each other to touch the east road marker stone. One didn’t come back.
complications: The missing child is hidden but tainted.
A lich agent ‘helps’ and demands a favor later.
Militia panics and starts arresting ‘spellcasters’.

grayhaven.gmOnlyNotes: Kellan can become a recurring ‘innocent witness’ and a vector for shards. If PCs ignore him, he will try again and get hurt.

grayhaven.gmOnlyJournal: NPC DOSSIER (GM): Caravan Master Sorn Dellik

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask for escort work
rumorTriggers.note: He has immediate paid leads.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about highwaymen or ‘black nails’
rumorTriggers.note: He describes tainted raiders and odd behaviors.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs mention trade declining
rumorTriggers.note: He blames safety, but hints at ‘something worse than bandits’.

questHooks.title: The Last Wagon North
questHooks.start: Sorn needs a one-trip escort north with high-value goods that keep the town’s economy alive.
complications: Highwaymen are tainted and don’t flee like normal humans.
Zhents demand a ‘fee’ to guarantee safety.
A storm forces a detour into the northwest woods.

questHooks.title: Blood on the Tarps
questHooks.start: Sorn found congealed black blood on his tarps after an overnight stop. He wants to know if it’s a curse.
complications: It’s from a blight-undeath creature passing nearby.
It’s planted by a lich agent to steer the caravan.
Selene’s shrine can test it, but doing so draws attention.

grayhaven.gmOnlyNotes: Sorn is a key Stability lever. If he quits, Grayhaven Stability advances +1 each week until trade resumes.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about wilderness routes or scouting
rumorTriggers.note: She provides a safe route and a dangerous truth.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs mention the east road ‘mouth’ phrase
rumorTriggers.note: She recognizes them as ‘in the know’ and shares more.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs bring her a blight-tainted token
rumorTriggers.note: She warns about ‘harmonics’ and refuses to touch it.

questHooks.title: Scout Contract
questHooks.start: Sera offers a paid scouting run to confirm whether a new bandit camp exists along the north road.
complications: Camp is actually Bloodcrust scouts.
Camp is a Zhent decoy to frame rivals.
Sera refuses to enter a fog pocket, forcing PCs to go alone.

questHooks.title: The Old Whistle
questHooks.start: Sera’s patrol whistle was stolen. She believes the thief is using it to lure travelers into ambush.
complications: The whistle is used by a lich agent to gather victims.
Militia thinks Sera staged it and tries to arrest her.
Recovering it reveals a hidden trail toward the Gloomwaste fringe.

grayhaven.gmOnlyNotes: Sera suspects the Gloomwaste isn’t ‘a curse’ but ‘a machine’. She can seed planar-work hints without naming a lich.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs snoop around warehouses or the stable
rumorTriggers.note: Vesk or his watchers appear to ‘chat’ and assess.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs interfere with a Zhent deal
rumorTriggers.note: Rumors turn hostile and precise, as if guided.

rumorTriggers.trigger: PCs ask about a ‘cavern’ or ‘split pine’
rumorTriggers.note: A decoy clue is planted.

questHooks.title: A Friendly Warning
questHooks.start: Vesk approaches PCs with a ‘warning’ to stop asking questions. He offers coin for cooperation.
complications: Refusal triggers surveillance; future encounters skew toward Zhent pressure.
Acceptance creates a paper trail that Harpers can exploit.
Vesk tests them with a small ‘harmless’ job that isn’t harmless.

questHooks.title: Waystation Run
questHooks.start: Vesk orders a delivery to the north-road cavern waystation. Payment is good; questions are not.
complications: The cargo includes blight-tainted reagents (lich agent supply).
Harpers shadow the run, offering a double-cross option.
Orcs raid the route, forcing a choice of priorities.

grayhaven.gmOnlyNotes: Vesk knows the waystation signs and can identify Harper code phrases. If captured, he bargains with partial truths.
